sen.j: 良遍（りょうへん、建久5年（1194年） - 建長4年8月28日 (旧暦)（1252年10月3日））は、鎌倉時代前期の法相宗の僧。
sen.e: Ryohen (1194 - October 3, 1252) was a priest in the early Kamakura period.
Ryohen (1194-October 3, 1252) was a priest of Hosso sect in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ハイフン前後のスペース削除、法相宗が訳抜けのため補完しました。
sen.e: Ryohen (1194-October 3, 1252) was a priest of Hosso sect in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His secular surname was FUJIWARA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His Azana (a popular name) was Ren'a.
sen.cmt: 蓮阿はヘボン式ではRenna と思いますが、登録に Ren'a 人名 2010/03/23 とありましたので、それを採用しました。
sen.e: His Azana (a popular name) was Ren'a.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His Azana (a popular name) was Rena.
sen.cmt: Ren'a→Rennaとしました（統一リストに従いました）

sen.j: 三位已講・生駒僧都とも称される。
sen.e: Also He was called as Sanmi Iko, or Ikoma Sozu (priest at Ikoma).
sen.cmt: 「三位已講」ですが、「三会已講」とは異なり意味も対訳も不明です。已講の意味は講師を務めた者とありますが、三位を third rank としていいとも思えませんでしたので、訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: He was also called as Sanmi Iko or Ikoma Sozu (priest at Ikoma).
sen.cmt: 語順変更、コンマ削除しました。
sen.e: He was also called as Sanmi Iko or Ikoma Sozu (priest at Ikoma).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 奈良興福寺で法相教学を学び、法印・権大僧都に任じられた。
sen.e: He learned the Hosso (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang) at Nara Kofuku-ji Temple, and was appointed Hoin (the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests), Gon Daisozu (the provisional highest grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: 本稿にあるように「法印・権大僧都」ではなく、http://wkp.fresheye.com/wikipedia/%E8%89%AF%E9%81%8D_(%E7%9C%9F%E8%A8%80%E5%AE%97)にあるように、「大僧都・法印」であればつじつまが合いますが、原稿どおりの訳出となっています。
sen.e: He learned the Hosso (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang) at Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara, and was appointed Hoin (the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) and Gon Daisozu (the provisional highest grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: 奈良興福寺の表現変更、コンマをandに変更しました。
sen.e: He learned the Hosso (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang) at Kofuku-ji Temple in Nara, and was appointed Hoin (the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) and Gon Daisozu (the provisional highest grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 覚盛から戒を受け、戒律の復興に尽力した。
sen.e: Ryohen received precepts from Kakujo and devoted himself to restoring religious precepts.
Ryohen received precepts from Kakujo and devoted himself to restoring religious precepts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ryohen received precepts from Kakujo and devoted himself to restoring religious precepts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 生駒竹林寺の住持となり、東大寺知足院を復興している。
sen.e: He became the chief priest at Ikoma Chikurin-ji Temple, and restored Todai-ji Chisoku-in Temple.
He became the chief priest at Chikurin-ji Temple in Ikoma, and restored Chisoku-in of Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 生駒竹林寺の表現変更、東大寺知足院の表現変更しました。
sen.e: He became the chief priest at Chikurin-ji Temple in Ikoma, and restored Chisoku-in of Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
